meanings.definition: Move from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The family translocated to a new city for a fresh start.
meanings.sent2: The workers translocated the boxes to the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The cat translocated to the sunny spot by the window for a nap.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts translocated from worry to excitement as she received good news.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a road trip translocated her mind to memories of past adventures.

meanings.sent1: The company translocated its headquarters to a bigger building.
meanings.sent2: She translocated the plants to the garden for better sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The magician translocated the coin from one hand to the other, impressing the audience.
meanings.sent4: His emotions translocated from sadness to joy upon seeing his family.
meanings.sent5: The painting translocated to a new exhibit, gaining more attention from art enthusiasts.
